metadata.Title: CVE-2019-11711 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.Description:
When an inner window is reused, it does not consider the use of document.domain for cross-origin protections. If pages on different subdomains ever cooperatively use document.domain, then either page can abuse this to inject script into arbitrary pages on the other subdomain, even those that did not use document.domain to relax their origin security. This vulnerability affects Firefox ESR < 60.8, Firefox < 68, and Thunderbird < 60.8.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2019-11711` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 68.0+build3-0ubuntu1
firefox-geckodriver - 68.0+build3-0ubuntu1
firefox-mozsymbols - 68.0+build3-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 60.8.0+build1-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 60.8.0+build1-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 60.8.0+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 60.8.0+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 60.8.0+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-lightning - 60.8.0+build1-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

notes.Note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine

criterions.comment: firefox package in impish was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '68.0+build3-0ubuntu1').
thunderbird package in impish was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '60.8.0+build1-0ubuntu1').
